conclusion: Determine the amount of heat exchanged using the first law of thermodynamics.
For a cyclic process, the change in internal energy is zero, so heat exchanged equals work done.
The cycle ABCDA is shown on a PV diagram with points A, B, C, D.
Segment AB is an isothermal expansion.
Work done during isothermal expansion AB is W_AB = nRT ln(V2/V1).
Heat added during isothermal expansion AB is Q_AB = W_AB = nRT ln(V2/V1).
Segment BC is an isobaric expansion.
Work done during isobaric expansion BC is W_BC = P2 (V2 - V1).
Heat added during isobaric expansion BC is Q_BC = C_p P2 (V2 - V1).
Segment CD is an isothermal compression.
Work done during isothermal compression CD is W_CD = -nRT ln(V2/V1).
Heat released during isothermal compression CD is Q_CD = W_CD = -nRT ln(V2/V1).
Segment DA is an isobaric compression.
Work done during isobaric compression DA is W_DA = -P1 (V2 - V1).
Heat released during isobaric compression DA is Q_DA = -C_p P1 (V2 - V1).
Total heat exchanged Q_total = Q_AB + Q_BC + Q_CD + Q_DA.
Substitute expressions for each segment into Q_total.
Simplify to get Q_total = C_p (P2 - P1) (V2 - V1).
The amount of heat exchanged is C_p (P2 - P1) (V2 - V1).
